moves.1. e4:
(Back one for intro)
This is my favorite opening move and I see no reason to deviate from it now.
moves.1... e5: Natural reply. I have seen it so many times, and I have experimented with countermeasures and I have chosen this one...
moves.2. Nf3: ...attempting the Ruy Lopez, by far the most common of my openings.
moves.2... Nc6: And I am obliged! Now it's time for the pin...
moves.3. Bc4: ...but no! A deviation from my norm! This will now either be an exciting battle or a quick death.
moves.3... d6: Of course. He wants his white-squared bishop to be free. Who doesn't?
moves.4. d4: The e pawn was waiting on his d brother, and now they will fight side by side...
moves.5. Nxd4: If black captures the knight, I have a devious plan.
moves.6. Qxd4: d4 is my queen's favorite square, even if she doesn't remain there for long...
moves.6... c5: Pawns cannot touch my Queen! How dare he!?
moves.7. Qe3: Cowering in fear of the "threatening" pawn :D
moves.7... Nf6: Puzzling...it adds little to his attack, and gives me time to do...
moves.8. Nc3: ...THIS! I am now ready to exploit the hole on d5.
moves.9. f4: !? Why did I not take d5 right now? I probably should have, but this will work fine.
moves.9... b5: I guess my bishop will have to retreat...
moves.10. e5: ...NO SIR! I always favor removing both of the opposing knights from the board over both bishops, and HERE is my opportunity. Here we go...
moves.11. fxe5: Now he has no protection from my queen...except for my pawn, who will hopefully be moving soon...
moves.11... Ng4: Something I did not predict. I fully expected a bishop capture followed by my capture of his knight. He opts to be aggressive against my QUEEN! No one touches her!
moves.12. Qf3: Doesn't really threaten the knight, but it DOES threaten something else...
moves.12... Ra7: This paved the way for the most controversial move that I played in this game...
moves.13. Qc6+: WHAM! Right thru that hole! Even if she isn't there for long, her presence will be remembered...
moves.13... Bd7: ? Queen exchange would've benefited him more than myself, but he doesn't want to...
moves.14. Qe4: My dainty queen is getting tired of this insolence!
moves.14... f5: YES! OH JOY! OH RAPTURE! Next move I get to say it!
moves.15. exf6 e.p.+: Pawn takes pawn en passant discovered check! YES!
moves.16. Qxe7+: WHAM! Queen straight into the jaws of Hell.
moves.16... Qxe7+ 17. fxe7: Poor pawn...so close, yet so far...
moves.17... Kxe7 18. Bg5+: Now that I have established a material advantage, it's time to exploit the lack of center pawns with this check. Not flashy, but workable.
moves.18... Ke8: ? Back to the home square? The monarch is far too passive!
moves.19. Be2: That knight was bothering me, so my loyal bishop said GET OUT!
moves.19... Ne5: Now that nothing can capture anything, it's time to secure my king. But...which side?
moves.20. O-O-O: I didn't know which was stronger, so I chose this side.
moves.21. Nd5: Long ago I said that I wanted my knight on the d5 square...and now, here he is!
moves.21... Bc6: Another knight threat. However, TWO can play at that game...
moves.22. Bf4: ...Now his big decision must be made. Exchange or no?
moves.22... Ng6: ??? Completely incorrect, for it allows THIS...
moves.23. Nc7+: ...WHAM! Check with a protected knight. I love it.
moves.24. Bc4+: BAM! More bishop action! Move, lazy monarch, move!
moves.24... Kf6 25. Rd6+: Forking the king and that pesky bishop
moves.27. Rf1: NOT! Now the knight has pinned himself! Bxg7 does not prevent a knight capture.
moves.27... Ke5: ? Walking right into the mouth of the waterfall? Why?
moves.28... Nxg2: This was expected. However, I had little hope for the kingside pawns anyway.
moves.29. Rxa6: I want the QUEENSIDE pawns. I have a distinct advantage over here, even though the a, b, and c pawns have not yet moved! :D
moves.29... Re7: Now the knight is hungry...better give him a snack...
moves.30... Ne3: Supposedly forking the rook and the bishop. However, the counterattack proved devastating.
moves.31. Re1: Now the knight is pinned! Black is now freefalling.
moves.31... Kf4: The king pin is over, but the knight still protects the ROOK on e7.
moves.32. Nd3+: I want to force the king towards the g and h files so my queenside pawns can promote.
moves.33. Ra5+: Testing to see if he will go to the h file
moves.34. Re5: The killing blow. He can forget about winning now.
moves.35... Rxe7 36. a4: NOW I am going to promote that pawn, and the knight is STILL pinned!
moves.37. b3 Kh3: This shouldn't be hard to figure out now. I'll give closing thoughts at the end. Just watch.
moves.38. Nf2+ Kxh2 39. Nxe4 Nxc4 40. bxc4 h5:
After this, black resigned. Black's only true mistake in this game was to underestimate the power that my queen had in the opening and the middle game. After I gained the material, black was toast. Thank you for watching one of my few wins. Feel free to send any comments as to what I might've done better. Thank you! :D
-Russell
